page.title: 13LITTLEPORT ADULT EDUCATION
page.content: In the Cambridgeshire Village College system, education after school hours is very important. Classes use the school buildings and field, while clubs and societies do also, if they affiliate themselves for a small fee. Participants' ages range from 16 to 70 and the service has been offered since 1948 (27 years). { {Winter}courses include typing, Indian cookery, computing, painting, keep-fit better driving and photography. In the {summer,}there are badminton, German, Duke of Edinburgh Award Scheme, choir and dance-exercise. Clubs include the Brownies and Beavers, football and cricket. An annual exchange is arranged with{Willich,}near Moenchen Gladbach in Germany. These activities will survive the closure of the village College.
